moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. g3 g6 4. Bg2 Bg7: This is a classic Closed Sicilian structure,where White attacks on the King-side,whereas Black launches an attack down the Queen-side.Black is hoping to soften White on the dark squares.
moves.11. g4 f5: Always a good move to play,when White plays g4.
moves.12. gxf5 gxf5: 12...ef is best here,with future pressure on the a8-h1 diagonal.
moves.13. Ng3 b4 14. d4: ?? This innocent and obvious looking move plays straight into Black's plan!
moves.14... bxc3 15. bxc3 Qa5: ? Missing a golden opportunity to play 15...fe! 16.Nxe4 cd 17.cd Nf5  -+
moves.16. e5 d5 17. Bd2 c4 18. Qc2 Bd7 19. Rab: White is trying to infiltrate with his Queen somehow,let's see...
moves.21... Rb6 22. Rxb6 Qxb6 23. Bc1: First though,White is trying to improve his worst piece.It would be ideally placed on the a3-f8 diagonal.
moves.23... Qa5 24. Qb2 Bc8 25. Ne1: ?? Overlooking a neat tactic ! Can you spot Black's next move ?
Putting pressure on White's position,with some nasty tactics in the air.
moves.29. a3 Qa4: ! Stopping White from playing Nb4,as his Knight on h5 would be lost with check!
moves.30. Bf3 Qb3:
!! White's last move was to protect his Knight,and stop the possible check on d1.
But now this thunderbolt places White on the back foot,as he cannot take the Queen,otherwise he would lose a piece,or the pawn would queen! He now has to give up a 2nd pawn.
moves.31. Qc1 Qxc3 32. Qd1 Nce7: I played this move,as I was afraid of White crashing through with 33.Bxd5 ed 34.Qxd5+
moves.36. Qb1 Nxe5: ! There goes a 4th pawn ! as the f pawn is pinned.If White now takes the Knight,then Black takes the Bishop on e3 with check.
The move 40...Qd7 looks tempting here,to force off the Queens.But,Black would be in for a big shock,as he would lose his Queen to 41.Nf6+ !
This looks aggressive,but in fact is a desperado,as Black can take this(though be careful which way you take! as 43...Nxf5?? 44.Qf8# !).
moves.43... exf5 44. Bd4+ Nxd4 45. Qe5+ Kg8 46: Black has been desperate to swap off Queens for most of this game,being material up.Here I find a way to finally achieve this.
moves.47. Qe3 Qa7 48. Nxf5 Qxe3+:
Here White resigned,as being a Bishop and 2 pawns down,it's hopelessly lost now.

0-1
